|Intitle=Know the definition of orthopaedic footwear
|Description=Definition of orthopaedic footwear and associated components (foot orthoses, etc.)
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Bisseriex Hélène,De Boissezon Xavier
|Order=9}}

Orthopaedic footwear :

*custom-made orthopaedic shoes = major orthopaedic appliances
**reimbursed from 60 to 100%, first pair prescribed by a specialist
**indicated if: neurological pathology, volumetric disorder, instability, inequality of length, limping... '''([[Sensory and/or motor neurological deficit SDD-121|sensory and/or motor neurological deficit]], [[Fall in the elderly SDD-027|fall in the elderly]]),''''
**carried out by a chiropodist or ortho-prosthetist
*''standard therapeutic footwear:'''
**CHUT (temporary use) or CHUP (permanent use)
**reimbursed at 60%, prescribed by any doctor
**indicated if: trophic disorders, oedema
*foot orthoses
**reimbursed at 60%,
**performed by a chiropodist, chiropodist or ortho-prosthetist.
*'''orthoplasty''': protects the toes[[File:Shoe.png|centre|vignette|Chaussure de décharge de série]]

question.question: Which of the following statements correctly describes orthopaedic footwear?
question.option_a: Orthopaedic footwear includes standard therapeutic footwear that is reimbursed at 100% and prescribed by any doctor.
question.option_b: Custom-made orthopaedic shoes are major orthopaedic appliances reimbursed from 60 to 100% and are indicated for sensory and/or motor neurological deficits.
question.option_c: Foot orthoses are reimbursed at 100% and are always prescribed by a neurologist.
question.option_d: Orthoplasty is primarily used to correct foot deformities and is reimbursed at 80%.
